root.name: updatePixels()
root.description: Updates the display window with the current data from pixels[]. It's possible to only update a portion of the window by specifying a smaller rectangle with the x1, y1, width, height parameters. The imageMode() function changes the way the parameters work. For example, imageMode(CENTER) will change x and y to define the center of the image. A call to imageMode(CORNERS) will change the width and height parameters to define the x and y coordinates of the opposite corner of the image.

parameter.label: x1
parameter.description: int: x-coordinate for the upper-left corner

parameter.label: y1
parameter.description: int: y-coordinate for the upper-right corner

parameter.label: x2
parameter.description: int: width or x-coordinate for the opposite corner depending on the current imageMode()

parameter.label: y2
parameter.description: int: height or y-cooordinate for the opposite corner depending on the current imageMode()
